events.name: DataBases 101

venue.name: Impact Hub Accra
venue.address_1: Opposite Taxi Rank ,Osu Ako Adjei Park

events.description:
This session forms part of a series of tech and digital career-focused training for Women Techmakers Accra and GDG Accra members.

We seek to introduce members to foundation level and career opportunities in selected topics in the tech field.

Trainer:  Eyram Seshie, specialized in data analysis and Python. 

RSVP on Meetup or Google Forms

events.name: 101 Series
events.description:
• What are the challenges involved in learning to program?

• Barriers to entry

• What to learn first, and afterward

• First languages?

Come online lets discuss these and more.

We will be streaming on youtube. -->Live Stream
events.how_to_find_us: This will be an online event - Link in the description below

events.name: DevFest 2017 - Ghana
events.description:
GDG Ghana is pleased to announce #DevFest17. Its that season that brings together developers from all walks of life, giving them a chance to showcase what they have been up to this year.

Its that season, where the community comes alive. This year is no different.

Our Focus this year -> Breaking Grounds

• What innovation are you working on?

• What's new in your area of influence?

• How different are you using old tech to make new art! 

Mother Ghana is on the verge of a #techsplosion, are you there with Her?  #gpsthings #$2.5 #Jack #Devfest17 #whereareyou #paperless #biometric

Come 25th November 10am. 

All roads will lead to NIIT. Opposite busy internet, Ring Road.

Tip of the Iceburg

• Breakfast/Networking

• SWAGS

Sponsors:

Google | NIIT Accra

events.name: Study Jam - Mobile Certification & Google Cloud
events.description:
• What we'll do
A community study event - study jam, this time focussed on web technologies, with concentration in mobile sites certification for the month of February.
The month of March will see us taking a peak behind the curtain of working with Google Cloud.
The goal is to support as many people as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community.

• What to bring
- Laptop
- GameFace

• Important to know
- Participants will require a gmail and github account to participate

- Participants will need to pass a prerequisite test to prove the have the necessary knowledge. Please take the test for the Mobile Web Certification Study Jam at this link -> https://github.com/GDGAccra/Studyjam , hint *problem.md*, follow instructions listed in the repository.

- Registration forms will be made available in due course, with dates & location.

- Google cloud study jam dates will be communicated later.
events.how_to_find_us: Meetup will be help at multiple locations in Accra. Venue will be communicated as soon as they are confirmed.

events.name: IWD 2018 : Pitch n Test Competition

venue.name: Impact Hub Accra
venue.address_1: Opposite Taxi Rank ,Osu Ako Adjei Park

events.description:
• What we'll do
It is a day for WTM ( Women Techmakers) Accra members to pitch, demo and test their products - apps and ideas for feedback and support.

The support comes in 2 folds :
Technical
Business Model Validation

This forms part of global WTM event series to mark International Women's Day.
Theme: Building a New Horizon

Note:
Mobile Web and Cloud Certification Assessment will also be conducted for members.

• What to bring
Laptop
Notebook
Pen
Water Bottle

• Important to know
Prizes will be awarded to top 3 performing teams

APPLY HERE: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScp9TzHPyN3iJDzSwoOwQy0Wzs_W0o_lNe5SvyYGkcKFaNg6A/viewform

events.name: IO Extended 2018 Accra

venue.name: Impact Hub Accra
venue.address_1: Opposite Taxi Rank ,Osu Ako Adjei Park

events.description:
This is a delayed(extended) viewing party to gather together people within the tech community in Accra to pore over content released during Google IO 2018.
Build actions for your community - Google Assistant
Building the future web together - AMP

Agenda:
Registration,Welcome, I/O Recap
The I/O Experience - Kafui Doris Anson-Yevu
The case for AMP - John Awotwi
Build Actions for Google Assistant - Jeffrey Godwyll

events.name: Build Actions for Your Community
events.description:
Design, build, and distribute fully-customizable conversational Actions across Google, using Dialogflow or one of our many templates.

Duration: 4 weeks, 3 hours per session

Instructor: Jeffrey Godwyll

Requirement:
- Bring your device

Expectations:
- Positive Attitude
- Passion to build amazing things

Who Can Attend:
Women Techmakers Accra Members
GDG Accra Members
Developers from other communities

Come Build Actions for Your Community!

events.name: Cloud Next '18 Extended Accra
events.description:
Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) lab, and local speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best Next Extended yet!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '18.

events.name: DevFest  Accra '18
events.description:
Don't just skip this part. Read to the end.

GDG Accra is pleased to announce #DevFest18. Its that season that brings together developers from all walks of life, giving them a chance to showcase what they have been up to in the year. It's that season, where the community comes alive. This year is no different.
Talks and Demos from #Android to #Firebase, #GCP , #IoT, #AI #ML and any in between.

This year, we would be using http://bit.ly/devfest-accra for registration.
Early Bird Tickets (Free) - First 50 to register
Bronze & Gold Tickets (Might be sold) - The remaining 100 seats.

Also visit http://bit.ly/devaccra for the agenda and speaker list - TO BE UPDATED SOON!

Come with the zeal, come with a friend, come with your laptops, come with your complimentary cards. Come one, Come all.

events.name: Office Hours
events.description:
We want to start out this year, listening to your concerns, thoughts on past events/meetups and how we can make this year more fruitful.

Hangout link below:

https://hangouts.google.com/call/Wyp7eNHO48WS8BKKugZFAEEI

events.name: IWD 19 Accra
events.description:
The Women Techmakers Global Event Series
Celebrating International Women's Day

In Accra, we will be highlighting the work of women tech communities and unearthing hidden STEM talent in our schools, innovation hubs, and workplaces.
There will be 2 sessions - "IamRemarkable" and AI related topic

The full agenda will be published in the coming week.

Click to save your seat here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdmmymSuvwH9QHj_CqRSUEZrXD8sNNeTsWW7QfDI5EZUTchxg/viewform

events.name: Waakye with a Googler
events.description:
Talk AI, Research & Share a Meal with Dr. Andrea Frome, a Research Engineer from Google.

*PLEASE DO WELL TO REGISTER WITH THIS FORM: https://forms.gle/D6KESV7xF4ekLgE38

**VERY LIMITED SEATING.

Dr. Andrea Frome earned her Ph.D. at UC Berkeley for work applying Machine Learning to Computer Vision problems. She worked at Google for almost eight years as a software engineer and leader on projects including Street View and Google Brain. After a few years away from Google, she returned to the company for the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be part of the team starting the first Google AI office in Africa hear in Accra. She's excited for this opportunity to talk with members of the community about her research and engineering work and many other topics before her assignment ends and she leaves Ghana in early August.

group_profile.intro: GDG's are for developers who are interested in Google's developer technology; everything from the Android, Chrome, Drive, and Google Cloud platforms, to product APIs like the Cast API, Maps API, and YouTube API and GDG Accra is no different.
